alert.note: Alert for Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 12:02PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Mineral County through 1245 PM PDT... At 1201 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms southwest of Gabbs, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Deadly cloud-to-ground lightning, wind gusts up to 50 mph, heavy rainfall, blowing dust, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Blowing dust could reduce visibility rapidly. Locations impacted include... Hawthorne, Luning, Mina, Mina Airport, Indian Head Peak, Nv 361 At Mineral-Nye Co Line South Of Gabbs), Rawhide, Junction U.S 95 And NV 360 (Tonopah Junction), Hawthorne Industrial Airport and Mount Ferguson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Blowing dust can be hazardous. Delay or reroute travel. Remain aware of the weather. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Reno.
